turn.2: On 12 September, General Sir Harold Alexander, the 15th Army Group commander, reported to General Sir Alan Brooke, the Chief of the Imperial General Staff (CIGS), in London: "I am not satisfied with the situation at Avalanche.
turn.4: The build-up is slow and they are pinned down to a bridgehead which has not enough depth.
turn.6: Everything is being done to push follow-up units and material to them.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: I expect heavy German counter-attack to be imminent." By 12 September, X Corps had taken a defensive posture because every battalion was committed and there were no reserves available to form an attack.
turn.9: Did they win against the Germans?
turn.10: In the south, the 36th Division made some progress but towards midday a counterattack by elements of the 29th Panzergrenadier Division overran the 1st Battalion, 142nd Infantry Regiment.
turn.12: On 13 September, the Germans launched their counteroffensive.
